title: Divorce Is in the Air - Gonzalo Torne.epub
description:
The American debut of a highly acclaimed young Spanish writer: a darkly funny, acerbic novel about loveâ€”and the end of loveâ€”and how hard it can be to let go. 

There's a lot about Joan-Marc that his estranged second wife doesn't knowâ€”but which he now sets out to tell her. He begins with the failure of his first marriage to an American woman named Helen, describing a vacation they took in a last-ditch attempt to salvage their once-passionate romance. The recollection of this ill-fated trip triggers in him a series of flashbacks through which he narrates his life story, hopscotching between Barcelona and Madrid. Starting from pivotal moments in his childhoodâ€”his earliest sexual encounters, his father's suicide, his mother's emotional declineâ€”he moves through the years to the origin of his relationship with Helen and the circumstances surrounding its deterioration. The result is a provocative exploration of memory, nostalgia, romance, the ways
